availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Nicholas county based farmer. Born in Pennsylvania in 1784. Moved to “Irish Station” in Nicholas County around 1792. Married Rachel Dills Johnson, deceased 1860. Father to Nancy P. Johnson Summit, Harmon D. Johnson, and William Mason Johnson.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850); Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860); U.S., Find a Grave Index, 1600s-Current, “Jonathan Johnson (1784-1869).” https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=johnson&GSfn=jonathan&GSby=1840&GSbyrel=before&GSdyrel=all&GSst=19&GScntry=4&GSob=n&GRid=71623847&df=all& (Accessed February 11, 2017
